data.title: Eat Out Downtown
data.text: This was a very fun dinner!  We stopped in for this special event and it was delicious.  They also have a wonderful selection of beers - A LOT!  I had a new Sour Ale that was amazing!

data.title: Downtown Duluth Beer And Burger Heaven
data.text: I hit the 7 West Taphouse regularly in downtown Duluth due to it's nice beer selection, great burgers, and friendly bartenders. While this is not a high end place, I give a 5 star rating because it does what it sets out to do very well.......provide a nice bar atmosphere that serves good food, feels fun, and is appropriate for a wide variety of customers. My usual routine is to come here for supper and few beers by myself and I keep coming back! The bartenders are friendly and just talkative enough and I also usually get into a conversation about something with the other people at the bar. They have a nice, small menu that is cooked right behind the bar and offers some innovative burger ideas and other simple meals. The house made chips come with your choice of seasonings and are a great addition to any of the meals. The tap beer selection may not be as big as some "beer snob" bars, but it is quite extensive and rotates to offer seasonal choices and can accommodate a variety of beer tastes. The 7 West Taphouse can get a bit busy, especially given it's fairly small size, but one great thing is that I see people move to let others have room, or even share a table, which is the way it should be! There are TV's so you can catch a game here, but it's not necessarily a sports bar so don't expect the TVs to be blasting the announcer. Parking is limited on Superior Street in front, but there is a nice public parking garage a block away on Lake Avenue and First Street that charges $1.00 and hour for parking and it's the way to go. So, if you're need a beer, burger, and a place to hang out, this is your place.

data.title: Great brews
data.text: Good selection and good eats. Lots of local brewery options. Stopped in here while the wife was next door shopping. I would have let her keep shopping for another hour or two!

data.title: Craft brews and amazing food!
data.text:
7 West Taphouse rotates a couple dozen craft beer choices including fine IPAs, home made potato chips, and hamburgers you won't believe at prices in the $6 range!  I loved the Tater Tot Burger (!) and the Poutine (with cheese curds, fries, and gravy so thick I ate it with a fork!)  
   The decor is tuck pointed brick, and the staff delivers friendly, efficient service.

data.title: Decent burger and too many beers to choose from
data.text:
Was in town visiting a friend and we didn't feel like going across to Superior to the outstanding Anchor Bar & Grill.

First off, you'll suffer from paralysis of choice with number of beers they have to choose from on the detailed beer menu.

Burger are above average, but their fresh made potato chips are to die for.

I'd go back.

data.title: Burger of the month and craft beers
data.text: While in town I decided to stop in for dinner.  They have a large selection of burgers and craft beers.  I had the burger of the month which was a bacon wrapped blue cheese stuffer burger with a balsamic sauce in a pretzel bun.  It was really good.  This latched with a craft beer tap list of 40 plus beers with excellent knowledge from the staff.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Love the food here, great atmosphere. Very friendly and helpful staff. They have a nice menu including apps, burgers and tacos. Also a great place for those who like craft beers!

data.title: Happening place!
data.text: Busy, fun, great staff, good food. Ate great first meal after long canoe trip. Full of youthful energy. I am done with this review and wish to submit it.

data.title: What's not to love?
data.text:
This place is great! The atmosphere is "come as you are" and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It's just a great low-key place to grab a beer and a bite.

The beer selection is fantastic and the Happy Hour is great. I believe in addition to the regular happy hour, they offered 16 oz. PBR's for $2.50! Gotta love that! 

They have a really nice menu with great burger selections. I had the burger of the month and it was the best burger I've had in ages. The prices are super too. I think my burger was right around $6.00. 

The 7 West Tap House is definitely one of my go-to places when I visit Duluth.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Burgers were yummy!! Won tons, jalapeno poppers and cheese curds were delish!  Beer was cold! Service was great! Enough said!

data.title: Excellent
data.text: My family thoroughly enjoyed the meal we had. The food was excellent. The burger was the best I've had in quite some time. The menu is very inexpensive.

data.title: Great apps!
data.text: Stopped for a quick beer and snack one afternoon. The chips were awesome and the cheese curds were great. They offer a variety of seasonings to put on both. They also have an awesome variety of beers on tap.

data.title: Lunch never tasted so GOOD!!
data.text: Beer, beer, beer, lots of beer choices.  You can ask for samples to choose the one you want!!  Lunch was great.  Recommend the bison burger, wow was it amazing, and not overcooked.  would of had a second beer, but it was busy and service a little slow, overall a great lunch.  Come hungry, leave satisfied!!

data.title: Great Beer House - if not busy
data.text:
Excellent choice, variety and quality of beer choices. They bring in and highlight different brew houses every so often, so will always get something different.  Food was very good. Typical bar fare with custom names.

If they aren't busy, street parking and finding a table will not come into play. Unfortunately, if they are full, they don't seat or organize, you and following guests have to figure it out and wait to grab the next spot that opens up.  A passing server just said to wait for an open spot when we asked. There is virtually no place to stand and feels awkward. Most tables seat 6-8, so great for parties of that size, but couples may find themselves sharing a table. 

For us, we had 5 and as one of our party was returning to us from the bathroom, passed a couple at a big table. The kind couple invited us over and we all shared a great time together. There were a dozen more folks waiting and we were "next" in line, but only because we knew that. 

In the end, great beer, food and company, but a little awkward without guidance at seating during busy times.

data.title: Place to go for beer
data.text: Always a nice selection of beer and friendly staff.  They have a good frequent customer program as well.  I know a bunch of people come here at lunch for quick food, but I would eat elsewhere if you have the time.

data.title: Zero service
data.text: Walked over to 7 west after finding them on this site and touring Duluth all day. We walked in and sat down at the only place available. Sat there for 20 minutes and not one single person acknowledged us. Menu and prices looked good and eager to try their items but no service. No drink orders. No "hey we'll  be right with you" or anything. Once we saw others sit down at the bar area and tables and were greeted right away we decided to leave. They didn't even acknowledge us leaving.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: When in Duluth you must check this place out.  A huge variety of beer - so many you might have difficulty deciding. And if that is the case just tell the bartender what kind of beer you like and she will set you up with something delicious. You also must try the homemade tacos and french fries. Absolutely delicious and amazing and we cannot wait to go back. Friendly fun and fantastic service!

data.title: Great food, beer, AND service!
data.text: I have been here twice in the last two months. Both times I was very happy with our overall experience. The burgers and fries are so yummy. There is a burger for every palate! The beer selection is the best in the area. And to top it off the server I/we had both times was excellent. Very attentive, knowledgeable on the beer, and personable. Can't wait to go back and try a different burger and fries flavor!

data.title: Beer and burgers
data.text: Lots of good tap beer, burger was on point great fast service and awesome prices. If your looking for a burger and beer on a budget this is the spot

data.title: I'm nearly a regular and I've never had a bad experience.
data.text: It's a Tap House with a great selection of beers and hard ciders. Burgers and fries are where they shine, skip the apps and tacos. The fries are fresh cut and fried to perfection, not limp, not greasy. Depending on the seasoning, the salt level can be overwhelming. The beef patties can be swapped out by a vegetarian patty (not vegan). The burgers are creative without being over the top or pretentious. My order came out around $15 (not including tip) for a burger, fries, and a craft beer. Not a bad meal for $20.
